text: Dean Edwards Smith (February 28, 1931 â€“ February 7, 2015) was an American head coach of men's college basketball. He was born in Emporia, Kansas. Smith was called a "coaching legend" by the Basketball Hall of Fame. Smith was best known for his 36-year coaching term at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Smith coached from 1961 to 1997 and retired with 879 victories, which was the NCAA Division I men's basketball record at that time. Smith had the 9th highest winning percentage of any men's college basketball coach (77.6%). During his tenure as head coach, North Carolina won two national championships and appeared in 11 Final Fours. Hill died in Chapel Hill, North Carolina at the age of 83. ==References== ==Other websites== *FIBA Hall of Fame page on Smith *North Carolina biography of Dean Smith (from 2011-12 media guide) *North Carolina biography of Dean Smith (archived from 1997) Category:1931 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Kansas Category:Sportspeople from North Carolina Category:People from Chapel Hill, North Carolina Category:Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame inductees
title: Dean Smith
